cospar.tmap.infer_Tmap_from_one_time_clones_twoTime¶

cospar.tmap.infer_Tmap_from_one_time_clones_twoTime(adata_orig, selected_two_time_points=['1', '2'], initialize_method='OT', OT_epsilon=0.02, OT_dis_KNN=5, OT_max_iter=1000, OT_stopThr=1e-09, HighVar_gene_pctl=80, Clone_update_iter_N=1, normalization_mode=1, noise_threshold=0.2, CoSpar_KNN=20, use_full_Smatrix=False, smooth_array=[15, 10, 5], verbose=True, trunca_threshold=0.001, compute_new=True, use_fixed_clonesize_t1=False, sort_clone=1, save_subset=True)¶

Infer transition map from clones with a single time point

It is the same as infer_Tmap_from_one_time_clones(), except that it assumes that the input adata_orig has only two time points.
